segment.source: You can delete an application through the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: You can delete an application through the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: This does not delete its Open Software Descriptor (.osd) file for other files from the Application Virtualization Server.
segment.target: This does not delete its Open Software Descriptor (.osd) file for other files from the Application Virtualization Server.

segment.source: After it is deleted, however, the application no longer streams to end users.
segment.target: After it is deleted, however, the application no longer streams to end users.

segment.source: If this is the only application in a package, deleting it also removes related package data and file associations.
segment.target: If this is the only application in a package, deleting it also removes related package data and file associations.

segment.source: In the left pane of the management console, click the Applications node.
segment.target: In the left pane of the management console, click the Applications node.

segment.source: In the right pane, highlight one or more applications you want to delete.
segment.target: In the right pane, highlight one or more applications you want to delete.

segment.source: You can use CTRL or Shift key combinations to highlight multiple applications.
segment.target: You can use CTRL or Shift key combinations to highlight multiple applications.

segment.source: Right-click the application or applications, and choose Delete.
segment.target: Right-click the application or applications, and choose Delete.

segment.source: In the Remove Application confirmation prompt, click Yes to complete the action.
segment.target: In the Remove Application confirmation prompt, click Yes to complete the action.

segment.source: How to Manage Applications in the Server Management Console
segment.target: How to Manage Applications in the Server Management Console
